sub_topic: Show that every group of order 60 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C60, the alternating group A5 Ã— C2, or one of the 32 non-abelian groups of order 60.
message_1: How many non-abelian groups of order 60 are there and what are their specific isomorphisms?
message_2:
There are two non-abelian groups of order 60, up to isomorphism. They are:

1. The symmetric group S_5: This group consists of all the permutations of 5 elements, and it has order 5! = 60. It is non-abelian because the order of the commutator subgroup is greater than 1.

2. The alternating group A_5: This group consists of all the even permutations of 5 elements, and it has order 60/2 = 30. It is non-abelian because the order of the commutator subgroup is greater than 1.

These two groups are not isomorphic to each other because their orders are different.
